thread.title: Report: Mack Brown not interested in Texas AD job
thread.title_full: Report: Mack Brown not interested in Texas AD job | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Report: Mack Brown not interested in Texas AD job
text:
Former Texas football coach Mack Brown is not interested in the Longhorns' athletic director job, he reportedly told CBS Sports.
Steve Patterson was fired Tuesday after just under two years as the Texas athletic director, leading to immediate waves of support for Brown to replace Patterson by former players.
Brown, 64, stepped down as the Longhorns' coach after the 2013 season following four straight single-digit-win seasons. He currently works for ESPN as an analyst.
Dallas Morning News reporter Chuck Carlton included Brown in his list of possible replacements for the Longhorns' top athletic administrator, though he wrote it was "probably not happening."
An excerpt from Carlton's list:
As the news broke, Brown's former players flooded Twitter with endorsements for him as AD. He actually did the job before at Tulane and he's still on the Texas payroll -- remember the Dubai trip? Brown would be a great fund- raiser. But a bunch of people look at the football product and still hold Brown accountable. Brown supervising successor Charlie Strong could get awkward. He might not be the uniter Texas needs now. Probably not happening.
Former Texas linebacker and Houston lawyer Mike Perrin is the school's interim AD.
Click here to read CBS' full report.
More on split of Texas, Steve Patterson
(Eric Gay/AP)
